cards: [ctx_1] California, United States — California SB976 — "Reporting mechanisms for inappropriate content exposure ### Section 22677"
[ctx_2] US — 18 U.S.C. 2258A - Reporting requirements of providers — "(2) Database"

[ctx_3] California, United States — California SB976 — "Track parental consent and control usage This law specifically targets social media platforms operating in California and requires geo-specific implementation to ensure minors in California receive enhanced protections while accessing social media services"
[ctx_4] Utah, United States — Utah Code §13-2c-301 et seq. — "Continuous monitoring and reporting"

passages.text: Reporting mechanisms for inappropriate content exposure ### Section 22677

(2) Database.Reports made to the CyberTipline of the National Center for Missing & Exploited Children shall be entered into a database that shall be maintained by the National Center for Missing & Exploited Children.

Track parental consent and control usage This law specifically targets social media platforms operating in California and requires geo-specific implementation to ensure minors in California receive enhanced protections while accessing social media services.
